moves.1. f4: my preferred bird opening, that explain the tittle ....
moves.1... d5 2. c4: "Mujannah opening" not easy to assume but it often make the surprise
moves.2... c6 3. d4 Bf5 4. Nf3 Nf6: this is the problem m with this variation : e4 is weak
moves.5. Nc3: in case of exchange, i will loose anyway the occupation of e4
moves.5... dxc4 6. e3: in order to retake 4, but black will play B5
moves.7... b4: was the  best answer, so my knight is in trouble but i can retake c4 again. so i plan to bring my c3 knight to the king side in order to attack black castle for after
moves.9... Be6: ok but i have a big problem on queen side and my bishops are blocked
moves.12. Bd2: preventing b3, this was a mistake met with c3 !
moves.12... c3 13. bxc3 bxc3: so  i  have to retreat and live there a black pawn in line 3, this smell burnt...
moves.14. Be1: the real problem of that is that now E3 is not protected and i risk a knight fork
moves.14... Nd5: i should saw it, but i didn't and this was my big loosing blunder. But continuing the game i return the situation and finish mating him, would you believe it ?
moves.15. Ne5: ??? maybe just something like Qc1 was enough to refute the fork threat
moves.15... Nxe3 16. Qd3: loosing a rook ! at this time i tough the game was lost : normally with strong opponent it s very rare to recover from such a loss
moves.16... Nxf1 17. Bxf1 O-O 18. Bxc3: one good thing in all that is that I can finally retake this bloody C3 pawn !
moves.18... Qc7: now blacks are missing plan because instead of my big blunder, i had resist. this is the opportunity to retake the initiative or, at least, the prepare some terrible plan
moves.19. Be2: in order to  put it on f3 to threat c6...a1. very long plan but my chance is that he anticipate it and give me another better opportunity to break his castle
moves.19... Bd5: you see,now i can advance the f4 paw in order to attack the castle and i have 2 bishop and 2 knight well situated...
moves.20. f5 Nd7: i wont leave the black knight come into the game, so i will exchange and then  go on breaking the castle
moves.21. Nxd7 Qxd7 22. fxg6 hxg6: i tought fx6 could be better for him, opening the f colon. He has a rook more so he could exchange rooks with me and get a leading situation
moves.23. Rf1: now my situation is quite good
moves.23... Rac8: preparing a push on queen side / center
moves.24. Bd1: preparing a attack on h7 after sacrifice knight...
moves.24... Qb7 25. Bc2: attack is ready. I tough he  will anticipate it, but not !
moves.25... Be6: so sacrifice will come on h5
moves.27. Nxg7 Kxg7 28. d5+: the threat with his rook to my queen will me give time and opportunity to place my queen on the good start square
moves.29... f6: but this d4 was also my "starting square" to go to h4 when necessary
moves.30... Rxd5: this threat on my queen is just giving me time to go on my h4 destination
moves.32... Kg7: would you play something better to avoid the mate ??
moves.36... Bg8 37. Qh6#: MATE !!! who had believe that it would be possible with a rook lost in middle game ?
